articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Syrian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from Syrian Ambassador
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Syrian Ambassador to the DPRK Tammam Sulaiman at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: U.S. and West Can Never Overpower Might of Syria and DPRK: Syrian President
articles.content:
U.S. and West Can Never Overpower Might of Syria and DPRK: Syrian President
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK led by Vice-Minister Sin Hong Chol had a talk with Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on March 8. 
					 At the talk the Syrian president said the historic relations between the two countries provided by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and HE Hafez Al-Assad are well known to the world. 
					
					 The delegation's Syria visit encourages the Syrian people in a difficult time, he said, stressing that the two countries, though far away from each other geographically, are waging an indomitable struggle against the common enemies U.S. imperialists and their allies. 
					
					 The shining victory won by the Korean people in the standoff with the U.S. greatly encourages the Syrian people in their struggle to defend sovereignty, stability and peace, the president said, adding:
					
					 The hostile acts of the U.S. imperialists make the relations between Syria and the DPRK stronger. The U.S. and the West can never overpower the might of the peoples of the two countries rallied close around their leaders.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Arrives in Belarus
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Arrives in Belarus
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation led by Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong arrived in Minsk, Belarus on March 8.

articles.title: Delegation of Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport Leaves for Mongolia
articles.content:
Delegation of Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport Leaves for Mongolia
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport led by Minister Kang Jong Gwan left here Tuesday to visit Mongolia.

articles.title: Merciless Punishment Awaits Provokers: CPRK Secretariat
articles.content:
Merciless Punishment Awaits Provokers: CPRK Secretariat
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Anti-DPRK hysteria is running high in south Korea at the instigation of the puppet forces with the racket of eliminating the "forces following the north" getting intensified following the recent attack on the U.S. ambassador in Seoul.
					 The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) Tuesday in information bulletin No. 1086 said in this regard:
					
					 The puppet south Korean forces almost every day egged ultra-right conservatives on to sponsor "a people's rally denouncing the forces following the north", fanning up anti-DPRK confrontation.
					
					 Those who are more dead than alive of the "Elders' Federation" and ultra-right conservatives including those of the "Association of Victims of Defoliants" went rampant in downtown Seoul every day, daring insult the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. This is an intolerable serious provocation and unpardonable hideous crime against the DPRK.
					
					 Lurking behind this is the sinister attempt to curry favor with the American master, stamp out pro-reunification and patriotic forces, quench the spirit for independence against the U.S. and "government" daily mounting among south Korean people and continue smear campaign against the DPRK.
					
					 There are no such despicable sycophantic traitors serving the U.S., die-hard confrontational maniacs and matchless fascists as the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK have already declared its resolute will to wipe out those who provoke the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK which Koreans regard dearer than their own lives.
					
					 The provokers who committed the heinous crimes daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK can never survive.

articles.title: Friendship Meeting of Aged Women in Pyongyang and Foreign Women Held
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting of Aged Women in Pyongyang and Foreign Women Held
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting of aged women here and foreign women residing in the DPRK took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Ri Chol Hui, vice-chairperson of the Central Committee of the Federation for the Care of the Elderly of Korea, officials concerned, members of the Association of Culture and Arts of the Elderly of Korea and aged women in the city.
					
					 Present there on invitation were women of foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 The participants watched a video introducing the activities of the Federation for the Care of the Elderly of Korea.
					
					 Then a performance was given by members of the Association of Culture and Arts of the Elderly of Korea.
					
					 Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as solos "Mother's Happiness" and "Ardent Desire" and trio "Song of Love for People".
					
					 The performance mesmerized the audience as it represented the happy aged women leading a worthwhile life, keeping the flowers of revolution in bloom under the loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea which respects and put forwards the revolutionary forerunners.
					
					 At the end of the performance, the participants watched aged women creating paintings.
					
					 The Korean and foreign women talked to one another, deepening friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Strives to Develop More Efficacious Medicines
articles.content:
DPRK Strives to Develop More Efficacious Medicines
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Pharmacy Research Institute under the Academy of Medical Science in the DPRK concentrates efforts on the development of high-efficacious medicines.
					 The institute has recently made big progress in manufacturing various kinds of Koryo (traditional) medicines on an extractive basis and developed a new medicine efficacious for recovering from fatigue.
					
					 Meanwhile, it is pushing ahead with the work to manufacture adjuvant from by-products of insam (ginseng).

articles.title: Tok Islets, Part of Korea's Territory: DPRK Scholar
articles.content:
Tok Islets, Part of Korea's Territory: DPRK Scholar
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries are now getting evermore pronounced in the scheme to grab Tok Islets of Korea.
					 However, Japan's historical data go to prove that the islets belong to Korea, said Dr. Ri Yong Sik, department head of Kim Il Sung University.
					
					 He told KCNA:
					
					 History books of Japan, published in the 17th century, refer to the patriotic activities of a Korean fisherman and to the fact that the then Tokugawa shogunate government of Japan acknowledged Ullung Island and Tok Islets are parts of Korea's territory.
					
					 Its old maps and modern history books, too, show that Tok Islets belong to Korea.
					
					 Contained in an official document issued by Japan's Meiji government on March 20, 1877 is the final decision that Japan has nothing to do with Ullung Island and another island (Tok Islets).
					
					 The fact that Tok Islets belong to Korea is also proven by Japan's historical data discovered in recent years. In 2012 some old maps of Japan were opened to the public, among them an old map showing Japan's proper and Tok Islets marked in different colors.
					
					 In general, historical data of Japan evidently prove that Tok Islets had never belonged to it.

articles.title: Ryongnamsan Sports Team of DPRK
articles.content:
Ryongnamsan Sports Team of DPRK
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Ryongnamsan Sports Team in the DPRK strives to contribute to the nation's sports development.
					 According to Choe Yong Gil, head of the team, its coaches and players are now intensifying on a scientific basis the training in wrestling, boxing, swimming and other events, with their will to honor Kim Il Sung University the team belongs to.
					
					 In recent years the team has shown good results in international and national sports games.
					
					 It won more than 50 gold, 30 silver and 30 bronze medals in 2014 alone.
					
					 Yang Kyong Il took the men's 57kg freestyle title at the 2014 World Wrestling Championships held in Tashkent of Uzbekistan, while Kim Un Hyang proved successful in the women's 10m platform diving event of the 17th Asian Games.

articles.title: Korean Art Gallery Demonstrates Might of Juche-based Fine Art
articles.content:
Korean Art Gallery Demonstrates Might of Juche-based Fine Art
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Korean Art Gallery has turned into the nation's reliable base for preserving cultural assets and a center for disseminating them while demonstrating the might of the Juche-based fine art.
					 President Kim Il Sung personally set the site for the gallery on the bank of the picturesque Taedong River and saw to it that it was built as a monumental edifice. On his initiative and under his energetic guidance the gallery was opened on August 14, Juche 50 (1961).
					
					 This year marks the 50th anniversary of Kim Il Sung's on-the-spot guidance to the gallery which falls on Tuesday.
					
					 He visited it to give important instructions which would serve as guidelines ranging from collection, expertising and studying of national art heritages, the proper inheritance of the time-honored tradition of the Korean painting and the use of art pieces for mass education to the principled demand to be met in selecting the themes of art pieces and displaying them.
					
					 With his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and wise guidance leader Kim Jong Il made sure that a fresh turn was brought about in the field of fine art.
					
					 The remodeled gallery exhibits many Korean paintings, acryl paintings, craftworks, embroideries and other art pieces in scores of rooms, with all conditions necessary for technical preservation, academic study, restoration and dissemination of fine art pieces.
					
					 More than ten exhibition rooms on the second floor showcase in a chronological order some excellent fine art pieces created by the resourceful Korean nation from the period of Koguryo dynasty to modern ages.
					
					 Exhibition rooms from the second to fourth floors have precious fine art pieces created in the historic annals of the country from the period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Condemn U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Condemn U.S.-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises
Tokyo, March 8 (KNS-KCNA) -- Officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) issued statements on March 7 denouncing the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet warmongers for kicking off the madcap joint war exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle. 
					 Kang Chu Ryon, vice-chairwoman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee and chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, denounced the U.S. and the puppet forces for kicking off the exercises, challenging the peaceful proposal made by the DPRK to remove the danger of war and defuse tension on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, said the officials of the federation and Korean workers in commerce in Japan bitterly condemn the war maneuvers by the U.S. and the puppet warmongers and will wage a more dynamic movement for national reunification.
					
					 Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, noted that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities are describing Key Resolve and Foal Eagle as "annual and defensive ones" but they are maneuvers for aggression to realize the ambition for "eliminating" the headquarters of the north and "occupying Pyongyang".
					
					 Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, said the present situation clearly proves that the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces, its stooges, are the very ones disturbing peace and stability on the Korean peninsula and escalating tension in Northeast Asia. 
					
					 Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, said the association and Korean social scientists in Japan will turn out as the pioneers and pathfinders of the times in the anti-U.S. sacred war for reunification to shatter the moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet group for a nuclear war.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Trying to Link Case of Attack on U.S. Ambassador with DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses S. Korean Regime of Trying to Link Case of Attack on U.S. Ambassador with DPRK
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group is making much fuss over the recent case of attack on the U.S. ambassador in Seoul.
					 What is ridiculous is its attempt to link the case with the DPRK.
					
					 The chief executive of south Korea, even before grasping the real situation, talked about "backstage forces" and cried out for thoroughly probing the truth behind the case. Pursuant to her order, the puppet group is busy holding a security meeting, etc. to kick off a racket of investigation after labeling the attack as a "deed of a follower of the north."
					
					 Presidential Chief of Staff Ri Pyong Gi undisguisedly revealed his sinister design to link the case with the DPRK, crying out for "taking a decisive measure" against "the forces denying constitutional value", "making a strict investigation into the case" and "clarifying as to whether there were wire-pullers or not" and the like. Those of the "Saenuri Party" are becoming increasingly vocal terming the case a "terrible one that targeted the heart of the south Korea-U.S. alliance" and "a deed of a follower of the north." They even talked about "the case's ideological linkage with the north".
					
					 This is part of moves of the puppet group to distract attention from the shame it experienced in international eyes, wipe out the pro-reunification patriotic forces and intensify its anti-DPRK conspiratorial racket in the international arena. 
					
					 As claimed by the attacker, his deed was an eruption of his protest and indignation against Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills now underway by the south Korean puppet group in league with its U.S. master.
					
					 As far as U.S. Ambassador Lippert is concerned, he is no more than a bellicose element that has been keen on conspiratorial smear campaign against the DPRK since he took an important post at the Defense Department, asserting missiles of the DPRK and its "programme for developing WMDs" are posing a "serious and direct threat" to the U.S. allies in the region and the U.S. territory.
					
					 Earlier this year shortly after his appointment as U.S. ambassador to south Korea, he appeared at a reception hosted by the U.S.-south Korea lawmakers' diplomatic council in Seoul. There, he talked such rubbish that "the DPRK will be unable to simultaneously push forward two fronts," urging it to make one of the two "choices" -- "abandoning its policy of simultaneously developing two fronts" or "getting exposed to severer sanctions."
					
					 At a meeting later, he talked such invectives that "the north can never pursue its prosperity and security as long as it has nukes."
					
					 No wonder, such a guy was attacked as he worked hard to realize the sinister design to stifle the DPRK and spoil the north-south relations at any cost.
					
					 The south Korean authorities' move to escalate the north-south confrontation by taking advantage of the above-said case is as foolish an act as digging up their own graves.
					
					 Conspiratorial smear campaign is no more than the last-ditch effort of those facing a crisis.
					
					 The conservative group of south Korea should not run riot, facing up to the situation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Living and Struggling in Revolutionary Spirit of Paektu
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Living and Struggling in Revolutionary Spirit of Paektu
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu, represents a powerful engine for the Korean revolution and basic sources of invincible might, says Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an editorial.
					 It goes on:
					
					 "Let us accomplish the Korean revolution in the revolutionary spirit of Paektu, the spirit of the blizzards of Paektu!" - this is the militant slogan put up by the Workers' Party of Korea and a signpost of victory.
					
					 This spirit is, in essence, a staunch spirit of attack, the spirit of weathering obstacles and difficulties and an indomitable fighting spirit of rising up no matter how often one may fall and fighting it out.
					
					 The anti-Japanese forerunners, the first generation of the Korean revolution, were the strongest in faith and will.
					
					 They had unshakable revolutionary faith that the country would be sure to be liberated if the nation followed President Kim Il Sung and it was a single-minded unity based on loyalty to him to share the destiny with him in the course of revolution, rain or shine.
					
					 They neither knew pessimism in hunger and cold nor wavered in their faith despite severe ordeals in 1941, but fought bravely even on scaffolds as they maintained blood ties with the leader.
					
					 This year is a significant year marking the 70th anniversary of national liberation which the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners achieved through their two decades-long bloody struggle under the leadership of the President.
					
					 This revolutionary spirit will greatly encourage the servicepersons and people of the DPRK in their patriotic drive for dashing ahead like the wind towards the grand festival of honor in all fields for defending socialism and building a thriving nation full of conviction of sure victory.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK Smear Campaign
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities worked hard to turn the recent forum of the UN Human Rights Council into a political charade for anti-DPRK smear campaign again.
					 The second vice-minister of the puppet Foreign Affairs let loose a spate of such groundless remarks as "inhabitants' life as human beings" and "concrete and sincere measure" in a bid to create impression that there are any problems in the DPRK. He cried out for "close cooperation" with international organizations for improving "human rights of the north" and "necessary support".
					
					 He also pretended to be interested in the humanitarian issues between the north and the south, talking about "confirmation of whereabouts of divided families between the south and the north" and "regular reunion." 
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary terms this sheer sophism of those who have turned south Korea into a mayhem under the fascist rule and the worst tundra of human rights in the world.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon the south Korean authorities busy with the anti-DPRK smear campaign over the non-existent "human rights issue of the north," while shelving unpardonable human rights abuses of their U.S. master and those committed by them.
					
					 If they are sincerely interested in the settlement of humanitarian issue between the north and the south, they should stop the war drills against the north kicked off together with outside forces to sour the atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation.
					
					 No matter how noisily they talk about humanitarian cooperation, shunning the saber-rattling, they can neither win sympathy from public at home and abroad nor evade the responsibility for the acts of standing in the way of reunions of divided families and relatives.
					
					 If they persist in their anti-DPRK smear campaign, backed by outside forces despite repeated warnings of the DPRK, they will have to pay dearly for acts of treachery.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Japan of Denying Sexual Slavery
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Japan of Denying Sexual Slavery
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- According to a report of interrogation about POWs of the Imperial Japanese Army which was declassified at the U.S. National Archives recently, sexual slaves Japan forcibly took to the Myanmar front during the Pacific war were all Koreans. Yuichishi, a service member of the Japanese army on the Myanmar front in those days, in an interrogation after he was captured by U.S. forces confessed that comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army were all Koreans. Had they been hurled into combat zones, they would have been killed by service personnel of the Imperial Japanese Army greedy for satisfying their carnal desire, he added.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary says this brought to light once again the truth about the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Japan forced 200 000 Korean women into sexual slavery with government and military power involved, inflicting unspeakable mental and physical pain on them. This was monstrous crimes against humanity unprecedented in the human history.
					
					 Japan is still denying the said crimes, claiming that there is no convincing evidence enough to prove the crimes. This is a foolish act of fully revealing the moral vulgarity peculiar to Japan.
					
					 These horrible crimes against humanity will never be forgotten no matter how persistently Japan may deny them.
					
					 Japan should clearly understand that it is the unavoidable legal and moral obligation for Japan to make an apology and reparation for these crimes.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Warned against Reckless Saber-rattling
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Authorities Warned against Reckless Saber-rattling
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Key Resolve and Foal Eagle war games being kicked off by the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are dangerous war drills to stifle the DPRK by force, say DPRK's leading newspapers on Tuesday in their commentaries. 
					 Rodong Sinmun notes: 
					
					 The aim sought by the U.S. is to ignite a war after preventing the DPRK from channeling its efforts into economic development and improvement of its people's standard of living and by making it get used to the constant war drills and slackening its vigilance. 
					
					 The war rehearsal is not targeting the DPRK only. This is pursuant to the U.S. aggressive pivot to Asia-Pacific strategy.
					
					 The U.S. seeks to tighten its control over the south Korean puppet forces through the joint war drills and use them as cannon fodder for encircling and containing countries in the region.
					
					 What the U.S. wants is not peace as evidenced by its policy of showdown and war with the DPRK.
					
					 So, it does not stand to reason to have dialogue with the U.S.
					
					 The opportunity for negotiated settlement between the DPRK and the U.S. has already been scuppered and military conflict has become unavoidable, the only issue that remains pending.
					
					 The reality urges the DPRK to further bolster up its war deterrent to cope with the U.S. military invasion getting highly possible. There is no other way for the former.
					
					 Minju Joson says the U.S. imperialists and the puppet forces are scheming to pressurize and browbeat the service personnel and people of the DPRK through the demonstration of their strength in the massive drills but such saber-rattling will only precipitate their final destruction.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korea Accused of Staging Joint Military Drills
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korea Accused of Staging Joint Military Drills
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Austrian and Slovenian organizations made public statements denouncing the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for staging Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises.
					 The Youth Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Austria said on Mar. 3:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists can never bring down socialism in the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean People's Army (KPA) is powerful enough to guarantee the happy life of the people with arms.
					
					 We are firmly convinced that KPA service personnel will win victory in the struggle to defend the country from the imperialists' aggression.
					
					 We hope that Korea's reunification, lifetime desire of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, will be achieved in a peaceful way.
					
					 We warn the U.S. and south Korean authorities to behave themselves.
					
					 The Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association said on March 4 that reckless war drills are a challenge to peace and an act of seeking permanent division of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 One should clearly know who will benefit from escalated tensions between the north and the south of Korea and who destroys peace, the statement noted, demanding an immediate stop to all acts that threaten others and escalate tensions in order to achieve peaceful development of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Call for Right to Existence
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Call for Right to Existence
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Sacked workers affiliated to the Tongyang cement branch of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions launched an indefinite sit-in after pitching up tents on March 2 outside the company building in Samchok, Kangwon Province of south Korea, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 They accused the management side of discharging at least 80 workers of the subcontract company on Feb. 28.  
					
					 They demanded it reinstate the workers as full-timers at once.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Calls for Building Independent Reunified World
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Calls for Building Independent Reunified World
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy in south Korea held a regular meeting at the Christian church in Seoul on March 7 at which it decided to fight against the racket for escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen and "eliminating followers of the north".
					 At the meeting speakers recalled that the association has worked hard for long-term prisoners and prisoners of conscience who fought for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					 Prisoners of conscience will continue existing unless the era of colony and division ends, they said.
					
					 They called upon Koreans to pool their efforts for national reunification.
					
					 They declared that they would stand against the racket for escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen and "eliminating followers of the north" to build an independent reunified world free from the "Security Law".
					
					 They called for waging a dynamic struggle to realize democratization through the second June resistance and win victory in the final standoff with the U.S.
					
					 A resolution was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: S. Korean Chief Executive's Sycophancy toward U.S. Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Chief Executive's Sycophancy toward U.S. Slammed
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Ri Jun Mu, member of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S., on Mar. 4 posted on his internet homepage an article denouncing the south Korean puppet chief executive for her sycophancy and policy of confrontation with compatriots.
					 The article said that the present chief executive let loose a spate of rigmarole in the "March 1 address", which was peppered with words inciting treachery, sycophancy and confrontation against reunification, disappointing the people.
					
					 It noted:
					
					 The chief executive kicked off war drills to do harm to compatriots in collusion with outside forces, while trumpeting about the "human rights of the north" in the international arena, thereby malignantly slandering the compatriots. Not content with this, she made solicitation visits abroad to garner support for the racket against the north.
					
					 Though it was clearly disclosed that the large joint military drills now underway under the pretext of "annual" and "defensive" ones are the aggression drills to inflict the nuclear disaster on the nation, the south Korean authorities still cry out for "dialogue".

articles.title: Women's Anti-"Government" Struggle Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Women's Anti-"Government" Struggle Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Actions calling for the rights of women workers were staged in various parts of Seoul on March 7.
					 The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally at Seoul Square.
					
					 Women workers of different units under the Confederation deplored the poor human rights situation such as suppression of labor movement, discrimination, violence and low wage.
					
					 On the same day the Federation of Trade Unions of south Korea held a meeting at Chonggye Plaza to adopt a resolution calling for making part-time women workers full-time and narrowing wage difference between man and woman.
					
					 Part-time women workers of the Public Transport Trade Union and universities held meetings to strongly urge the puppet authorities to ensure the rights of women.

articles.title: Scandals Rampant in S. Korean Puppet Army
articles.content:
Scandals Rampant in S. Korean Puppet Army
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Scandals are revealed one after another within the south Korean puppet army.
					 Jong Ok Gun, former puppet navy chief of Staff, was indicted again for graft, according to KBS of south Korea.
					
					 He was accused of bribery running tens of millions of won for recommending a corporate capable of providing information collection devices for a spy ship of the navy. 
					
					 This bribery case was brought to light when he was on trial for the graft to the tune of hundreds of millions of won. 
					
					 On March 6 several officers were put in custody on charges of faking up the examination paper on the equipment to be mounted on the warship during their services in the puppet defence agency.
					
					 A general of the puppet navy committed suicide on Jan. 28 following the disclosure of his involvement in a bribery scandal.
					
					 The south Korean puppet army has long been jeered by the public for serious relaxation of military disciplines and corruption.

articles.title: Representative of S. Korean Paper Calls for Fulfilling Media's Mission and Responsibility
articles.content:
Representative of S. Korean Paper Calls for Fulfilling Media's Mission and Responsibility
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Jaju Ilbo, an internet paper of south Korea, said it would conduct its activities for independence, democracy, peace, people's life and truth.
					 Ri Jong Sop, representative of Jaju Ilbo, noted that the paper would strive to reunify the divided country, oppose war maneuvers and confrontation with fellow countrymen and achieve national reconciliation and cooperation.
					
					 He expressed the will to make every effort to achieve peaceful reunification by implementing the July 4 joint statement, three principles of national reunification, June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration being supported by not only Koreans in the north, the south and abroad but other peoples in the world.
					
					 He said the paper would fulfill media's mission and responsibility for factual and truthful report.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Benin
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Benin
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A Beninese national preparatory committee for celebrating the 103rd birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was formed in Cotonou on March 4.
					 Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events to praise the immortal exploits of the President on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (his birth anniversary).

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Figures of Benin
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Figures of Benin
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- Figures of Benin lauded the exploits of President Kim Il Sung at an inaugural ceremony of a Beninese national preparatory committee for celebrating his 103rd birth anniversary.
					 At the inaugural ceremony on March 4, Hessou Kohovi, chairman of the Benin National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as chairman of the Benin-Korea Amicable Association "Long Live Kim Jong Il, Supreme Leader", said:
					
					 The progressives are highly praising the President, founder of socialist Korea, as the eternal sun of Juche.
					
					 The President founded the Juche idea and thus provided the eternal guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 The President who embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years founded the Juche idea at the historic Kalun Meeting and indicated the path to be followed by the Korean revolution, based on it.
					
					 Thanks to the founding of the Juche idea, a new era of history, the era of independence has opened in which the popular masses, who had been subject to the vicissitude of history, thinking they are destined to be slaves, are independently and creatively exploring the path of the times and revolution as the master of the world and their own destiny.
					
					 Pascal Zouncheme, chief of the Benin Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, praised the President as the closest comrade and friend of the world revolutionaries and the progressive people.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the President met a lot of foreign personages of various circles and gave them clear answers to the matters arising in the revolution and construction and rendered positive help to the African people in their struggle for the independence of the country and building of a new society.
					
					 He stressed that President who explored the independence era and devoted his all to the victorious advance of the cause of human independence will be alive in the hearts of the people aspiring after independence.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Myanmar
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- A Myanmar preparatory committee for celebrating the 103rd birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Yangon on March 6.
					 At an inaugural ceremony, Aung Thein Lynn, member of the Central Executive Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold various political and cultural events including a meeting, friendship meeting, film show and photo exhibition on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (his birth anniversary).

articles.title: Halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Demanded by Romanian Body
articles.content:
Halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle Demanded by Romanian Body
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Romanian Workers' Association issued a statement on March 3 in denunciation of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces' joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle.
					 The statement said that a dangerous climate in which a new war may be ignited is being created on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Their assertion that the exercises are "annual" and "defensive" is nothing but a clumsy pretext and the large-scale military exercises are a preliminary war for invading the DPRK from A to Z.
					
					 We fully support the statement of the spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army and the statement of the spokesman for the DPRK Foreign Ministry in which they accused the aggressive U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises and declared their will to mercilessly punish the provokers.
					
					 We also urge the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to immediately halt the joint military exercises and withdraw all their armed forces for aggression from the Korean peninsula and its surrounding areas.
					
					 The U.S. can not bring to its knees the Korean people who are single-mindedly united around their leader and have a powerful army but will meet a doom.
					
					 It should clearly bear in mind that tiger moth fond of playing with fire is bound to perish in flames.
					
					 The Korean people, who turned out in the struggle against the U.S., will certainly win the final victory.
					
					 The world progressives will always stand with the righteous Korean people.

articles.title: Japanese Organization Demands Stop to U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills
articles.content:
Japanese Organization Demands Stop to U.S.-S. Korea Military Drills
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea made public a statement on March 5 in denunciation of the joint military drills for aggression by the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces. 
					 The joint military drills Key Resolve and Foal Eagle that started on March 2 reveal the aggressive nature of the U.S., the statement said, and went on:
					
					 During the joint military drills last year the formation of the U.S. nuclear strategic bombers staged nuclear strike exercises in the sky above the Korean peninsula and large landing operation with the mobilization of naval and air forces in the Phohang area of south Korea. 
					
					 Where are they going to drop nuclear bombs and where are they going to land?
					
					 Even a mere child knows that. 
					
					 They are aggressive war exercises aiming at "occupation of Pyongyang". 
					
					 The unwarranted and dangerous military drills should be stopped at once. 
					
					 We desirous of peace and independent reunification of the Korean peninsula strongly demand the U.S. and south Korea stop the military drills and sincerely respond to the dialogue repeatedly called for by the DPRK.

articles.title: German Organization Denounces U.S. Moves to Stifle DPRK
articles.content:
German Organization Denounces U.S. Moves to Stifle DPRK
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany sent a protest letter to the U.S. embassy in Berlin on March 5 in denunciation of the evermore vicious moves of the U.S. imperialists to stifle the DPRK.
					 Referring to the fact that the U.S. imperialists are busy with the "human rights" racket against the DPRK, the letter said:
					
					 The U.S. which had put south Korea under its control long ago has ceaselessly conducted reckless war moves and despicable psychological warfare against socialist Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. is spending a huge amount of funds for the purpose. 
					
					 It is very just that the DPRK has access to a strong nuclear deterrence for self-defence. 
					
					 The U.S. is the worst human rights abuser in the world as it has historically resorted to aggression and man-killing in different parts of the world. 
					
					 The DPRK set forth the fairest proposals for peace and reunification of the Korean peninsula and has made every effort to achieve them. 
					
					 However, the U.S. finally responded to it with the aggressive nuclear war exercises with the south Korean authorities. 
					
					 We strongly denounce the U.S. moves to stifle the DPRK.

articles.title: French Organization Supports DPRK
articles.content:
French Organization Supports DPRK
Pyongyang, March 10 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association sent a letter to the chairman of the UN Human Rights Council on March 1 as regards the fact that the "human rights issue" of the DPRK will be put for discussion at the 28th Session of the UN Human Rights Council in Geneva. 
					 The letter said that the France-Korea Friendship Association desirous of peace and reunification of Korea hopes that the UN Human Rights Council would seriously approach the discussion of the human rights of Korea.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 We are strongly skeptical about the results of the UN Commission of Inquiry on the DPRK. 
					
					 We recognize that the work of the Commission of Inquiry is unfair and incongruous with the international standard. 
					
					 The commission made "investigations" outside the relevant country irrespective of the will of that country and hastily made public its "will" conflicting with reality. 
					
					 This is aimed to "incriminate" the DPRK which is always ready for negotiations for discussing such agenda items as respect for independence, basic human rights and fundamental issue of international law.
					
					 We cannot but deplore the "results of investigation" on the situation of human rights in the DPRK which even several international and NGO bodies deny. 
					
					 Different "key evidence" published by the Commission of Inquiry was cooked up based on false stories made by "defectors from north Korea" and the contents are full of inconsistency. 
					
					 The foolish moves to place the DPRK in the dock at the International Criminal Court will not succeed but bring serious denunciation that the UN Human Rights Council turned into a political tool serving some countries. 
					
					 The "report" of the Commission of Inquiry is only escalating the tension of the Korean peninsula, far from bringing peace and reunification of Korea. 
					
					 We hope that the human rights issue will be fairly settled.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador siriaco en Corea
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales del nuevo embajador siriaco en Corea
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ACNC) -- Tammam Sulaiman presento el dia 10 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae ante el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, sus cartas credenciales que le acreditan como nuevo embajador extraordinario y plenipotenciario de la Republica Arabe de Siria en la RPDC.
					Tras recibirlas, Kim converso con el diplomatico.

articles.title: Siria y Corea no se doblegaran ante EE.UU. y el Occidente, afirma Bashar al-Assad
articles.content:
Siria y Corea no se doblegaran ante EE.UU. y el Occidente, afirma Bashar al-Assad
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ACNC) -- La delegacion del MINREX de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, encabezada por el vicecanciller Sin Hong Chol, de visita en Siria, se reunio el dia 8 con el presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Bashar al-Assad.
					En la ocasion, el mandatario dijo que son ampliamente conocidas en el mundo las relaciones historicas entre los dos paises, preparadas por Su Excelencia Presidente Kim Il Sung y Su Excelencia General Kim Jong Il junto con Su Excelencia Hafez Al-Assad.
					
					Continuo que la visita de la delegacion coreana constituye un estimulo para el pueblo siriaco que atraviesa dificultades y anadio que aunque se encuentran lejos geograficamente, los dos paises luchan indoblegablemente contra el imperialismo norteamericano, enemigo comun, y sus satelites.
					
					Destaco que las brillantes victorias alcanzadas por el pueblo coreano en la batalla de confrontacion con Estados Unidos infunden gran fuerza al pueblo siriaco que lucha por defender la soberania, la estabilidad y la paz.
					
					Apunto que se hicieron mas solidas las relaciones Siria-Corea debido a los actos hostiles del imperialismo norteamericano y agrego que EE.UU. y el Occidente no podran doblegar nunca las fuerzas de dos paises unidos firmemente en torno a sus lideres.

articles.title: ACNC rechaza acusacion de titeres surcoreanos en el tema de asalto al embajador norteamericano
articles.content:
ACNC rechaza acusacion de titeres surcoreanos en el tema de asalto al embajador norteamericano
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ACNC) -- Despues de que fuera castigado el embajador estadounidense en un lugar centrico de Seul, los titeres surcoreanos tratan de vincular este incidente con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Aun antes de que se cerciorara de lo ocurrido, la mandataria surcoreana ordeno descubrir a las "fuerzas" que segun ella, estan detras del incidente.
					
					En acato a esa orden, los titeres surcoreanos realizan una investigacion convocando una tras otra la reunion de seguridad, la consulta de alto nivel del Partido Saenuri, el gobierno y Chongwadae, etc. en que calificaron el incidente de "obra de las fuerzas seguidoras al Norte de Corea".
					
					El jefe del gabinete de secretarios de Chongwadae, Ri Pyong Gi, expuso abiertamente su malsana intencion de vincular el incidente con la RPDC, diciendo que hay que "tomar las medidas fundamentales y averiguar cabalmente a las fuerzas que niegan el valor constitucional" y "esclarecer verdaderos aspectos sobre la existencia de las fuerzas traseras".
					
					Los pandilleros del "Partido Saenuri" acusan a la RPDC disparateando que eso es el "incidente terrible que apunta el corazon de la alianza Sur de Corea-EE.UU." y "obra del seguidor al Norte" y hay la "posibilidad de relacion ideologica con el Norte".
					
					Esta acusacion parte del intento de reducir la verguenza, que ya sufren ellos en la arena internacional, al distraer la atencion de la opinion publica y aprovechar el incidente para exterminar las fuerzas patrioticas pro-reunificacion y recrudecer la campana internacional anti-RPDC.
					
					Como ha insistido el asaltante, el presente caso es una expresion de protestas a los ejercicios militares conjuntos Key Resolve y Foal Eagle que libra la banda titere surcoreana con su amo gringo.
					
					Lippert es el belicista que desde cuando ocupaba un cargo importante del Pentagono, se dedicaba a la demagogia y complot contra la RPDC diciendo que los misiles y el "programa de armas de exterminio masivo" de ella constituyen la "amenaza seria y directa" para los paises aliados de la region y el territorio de EE.UU.
					
					A principios de este ano, poco despues de ser nombrado como embajador norteamericano en el Sur de Corea, asistio al banquete ofrecido por el consejo diplomatico de legisladores  EE.UU.-Sur de Corea y critico la linea de la RPDC de impulsar paralelamente la construccion economica y la de fuerzas armadas nucleares.
					
					Chismeando que "es imposible hacer dos cosas al mismo tiempo", se atrevio a exigir a la RPDC tomar una opcion ante estas alternativas: "renunciar la politica de desarrollo paralelo" o "sufrir la sancion".
					
					En una reunion posterior, dijo que el Norte de Corea "no puede perseguir la prosperidad y seguridad portando armas nucleares".
					
					Merece ser castigado Lippert que se obstina en aplastar a la RPDC y romper las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas cometen un acto suicida al agravar el enfrentamiento Norte-Sur aprovechando el incidente mencionado.
					
					La calumnia y el complot son ultimo remedio de los que se hallan en crisis.
					
					Los conservadores surcoreanos deben actuar con juicio viendo correctamente la realidad.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena a Japon que niega crimen de esclavitud sexual
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena a Japon que niega crimen de esclavitud sexual
Pyongyang, 10 de marzo (ACNC) -- Segun el informe de interrogacion de un prisionero del ex ejercito japones recien descubierto en los Archivos Nacionales de Estados Unidos, eran coreanas todas las esclavas sexuales despachadas a fuerza por Japon al frente de Myanmar en el periodo de la guerra del Pacifico.
					Yuichishi, capturado en aquel tiempo por las tropas norteamericanas como un miembro del ex ejercito japones emplazado en el frente de Myanmar, confeso en la interrogacion que todas las 'consoladoras' para el ejercito japones son las coreanas y si ellas se hubieran enviado a la zona de combate, habrian muerto por los soldados japoneses avidos de vida sexual".
					
					De esta manera se revelo otra vez a todo el mundo el verdadero aspecto del crimen de esclavitud sexual del ex ejercito japones.
					
					Asi adelanta el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido el dia 10 y continua:
					
					Japon convirtio a mas de 200 mil coreanas  en las esclavas sexuales poniendo en funcionamiento la autoridad del gobierno y la militar y les impuso innumerables sufrimientos espirituales y fisicos. Tal crimen de esclavitud sexual del viejo ejercito japones es el antietico de gran tamano sin precedente en la historia de la humanidad.
					
					A pesar de esto, Japon niega el mismo crimen de esclavitud sexual diciendo que no hay pruebas correctas para comprobarlo.
					
					Asi  pone al desnudo por si mismo su propia bajeza moral.
					
					El crimen antietico de gran tamano cometido por el viejo ejercito japones nunca desaparecera aunque lo niegue y transcurra el tiempo.
					
					Japon debe conocer exactamente que la disculpa y la indemnizacion por el respecto son el inevitable deber juridico y moral.
